chargeHist.descr: Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/OWI (Passenger < 16 Yrs) and Cause Injury-Operating w/ PAC-Passenger. The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/OWI (Passenger < 16 Yrs) and the other charge, Cause Injury-Operating w/ PAC-Passenger was dismissed by the court.

  • Chad R Taylor was found guilty of Cause Injury/OWI (Passenger < 16 Yrs), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The judgment of conviction is amended that the Defendant is to attend the Victim Impact Panel on August 19, 2015 or 5 days jail signed by Judge Aprahamian on 6/30/15.

Dated June 23, 2015 filed by Department of Corrections regarding Defendant's missed appearance at the June 17, 2015 victim impact panel with attached proposed order to impose 5 days condition time or they would not object to the Defendant attending the August 19, 2015 meeting.
Dated June 23, 2015 filed by Attorney LaVoy with attached proposed order to allow Defendant to attend the August 19, 2015 victim impact panel instead.
that the Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect that Defendant's conditional jail sentence be served with good time credit. signed by Judge Aprahamian, dated 04/23/2015.

Defendant Chad R Taylor in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting good time credit on the defendant's condition time. State has no objection. Court orders defendant is entitled to good time credit. Court signs the order for good time credit.
Review hearing on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Email dated 4/16/15  from Attorney LaVoy requesting matter be set for a hearing with reference of other cases with requests for good time credit.  Email forwarded to parties.
Per Judge Aprahamian.  Order signed on 4/2/15 stating conditional jail time to be served with good time credit is stayed pending further review by the Court.

It is hereby ordered that the judgment of conviction in this case be amended to reflect the Defendant's conditional jail sentence to be served with good time credit udner Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.09(1)(d).  Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 4/2/15.
On 4/14/15 Upon reconsideration by Judge Aprahamian and review of statues, order is vacated and motion is denied.
Dated 4/1/15 filed by Attorney LaVoy with attached proposed order granting good time credit on his condition time.

Filed by the Defendant requesting that the balance of his sentence be served at the Huber Facility.
Per jail records Defendant is in custody at the Huber Facility. 4/1/15.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Chad R Taylor in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2, 3 and 7 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 4, 5, 6 and 8 dismissed by operation of law.  Dr. Steven Best, Beth T., Ben T., made statements.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
-  Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation - 2 days credit if revoked
- Fine totaling $1519.00 - apply bail - balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department -  append to fine - to be paid as a Condition of Probation. 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - append to fine -  to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Transcript fee of $24.00 to be forwarded to the DA's office - to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on June 17, 2015 or 5 days jail
-  2 years Drivers License Revocation. 
-  2 years Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 60 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 03/24/2015 by 6:00 p.m.. Non Working hours with standard release conditions.

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Cash bail previously posted.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  To be installed within the next business day.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Chad R Taylor in court with attorney Rebecca E. LaVoy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lavoy waives the filing of the information until the next hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
